tool.name: Calculate protein FDR
tool.command:
#if $qvality.type in ["pickfasta", "pickresult"] msspeptable modelqvals -i '$targetpeptable' -o targetpeplinmod.txt --scorecolpattern "$qvality.scorecolpattern" --fdrcolpattern "$qvality.qvaluecolpattern" && msspeptable modelqvals -i '$decoypeptable' -o decoypeplinmod.txt --scorecolpattern "$scorecolpattern" --fdrcolpattern $qvaluecolpattern #else ln -s "$targetpeptable" targetpeplinmod.txt && ln -s "$decoypeptable" decoypeplinmod.txt #end if
&& mssprottable bestpeptide -i '$targetproteins' -o targetbestpeptides.txt --peptable targetpeplinmod.txt --scorecolpattern #if $qvality.type in ["pickfasta", "pickresult"] 'linear model' #else '$qvality.scorecolpattern' #end if #if $minlog --logscore #end if #if $proteincolumn.value --protcol $proteincolumn #end if && mssprottable bestpeptide -i '$decoyproteins' -o decoybestpeptides.txt --peptable decoypeplinmod.txt --scorecolpattern #if $qvality.type in ["pickfasta", "pickresult"] 'linear model' #else '$qvality.scorecolpattern' #end if #if $minlog --logscore #end if #if $proteincolumn.value --protcol $proteincolumn #end if && mssprottable #if $qvality.type in ["pickfasta", "pickresult"] pickqvality #if str($qvality.type) == "pickfasta" --targetfasta $tfasta --decoyfasta $dfasta #if $qvality.fastadelim --fastadelim $qvality.fastadelim #end if #if $qvality.genefield --genefield $qvality.genefield #end if #end if #else if $qvality.type in ["qvalue", "probability"] qvality --feattype $qvality.type #end if #if $qoptions.yesno.value == "yes" --qoptions #if $qoptions.epsilon_step ***epsilon-step $qoptions.epsilon_step #end if #if $qoptions.number_of_bins ***number-of-bins $qoptions.number_of_bins #end if #if $qoptions.epsilon_cross_validation ***epsilon-cross-validation $qoptions.epsilon_cross_validation #end if #if $qoptions.reverse.value == "true" ***reverse #end if #if $qoptions.generalized.value == "true" ***generalized #end if #end if -i targetbestpeptides.txt --decoyfn decoybestpeptides.txt -o qvalityout.txt && mssprottable fdr -i targetbestpeptides.txt -o '$output' --qvality qvalityout.txt --scorecolpattern '^Q-score'

param.name: proteincolumn
param.label: Peptide table column with protein accessions if not standard Master protein column

param.name: minlog
param.label: Use -log10 of a peptide's score
param.help: E.g. when using q-values to calculate best peptide Q-score

param.name: scorecolpattern
param.label: Regular expression pattern to determine scorecolumn for linear modeling of q-values in peptide file

param.name: qvaluecolpattern
param.label: Regular expression pattern to determine q-value column in peptide file

param.name: fastadelim
param.label: FASTA delimiter
param.help: In case FASTA is not ENSEMBL or Uniprot you may be able to use a simple splitter to parse out the gene names. The delimiter is what splits the fields.

param.name: genefield
param.label: Gene field number
param.help: To be used together with FASTA delimiter, this is the number of the field in which the gene name is in. First field is nr. 1

param.name: scorecolpattern
param.label: Regular expression pattern to determine scorecolumn for linear modeling of q-values in peptide file

param.name: qvaluecolpattern
param.label: Regular expression pattern to determine q-value column in peptide file

param.name: scorecolpattern
param.label: Regular expression pattern to determine scorecolumn for getting best peptide for protein

param.name: scorecolpattern
param.label: Regular expression pattern to determine scorecolumn for getting best peptide for protein

param.name: epsilon_step
param.label: qvality Epsilon step
param.help: The relative step size used as treshhold before cross validation error is calculated. A number between 0 and 1

param.name: number_of_bins
param.label: qvality Number of bins
param.help: The number of spline knots used when interpolating spline function. Default: 500

param.name: epsilon_cross_validation
param.label: qvality Epsilon cross validation
param.help: The relative crossvalidation step size used as treshhold before ending the iterations. A number between 0 and 1.

param.name: reverse
param.label: qvality Reverse
param.help: Indicating that the scoring mechanism is reversed, i.e. that low scores are better than higher scores

param.name: generalized
param.label: qvality Generalized
param.help: Generalized target decoy competition, situations where PSMs known to more frequently be incorrect are mixed in with the correct PSMs

tool.help: This tool takes a protein table and adds protein FDR columns to it. It follows Savitsky et al and can deliver picked FDR for gene tables, or from the same paper deliver FDRs derived from the protein's Q-score (-log10 of q-value of the protein's best peptide).
